requests.name: Get your page profile
requests.description: Get your page profile

requests.name: Update your page profile
requests.description: Update your page profile

queryParams.description: name of your page to be displayed
the website of your page. clicking on your status page image will link here
if users reply to the incident notifications we send
time zone to use for your status page display (must be a rails time zone)
city in which your page is headquartered
state in which your page is headquartered
country in which your page is headquartered
subdomain at which to access your status page (your_subdomain.statuspage.io)
CNAME alias for your status page (point DNS record to hosted.statuspage.io)
which layout format to use for your status page. one of basic|premium
allow users to subscribe for email updates (t or f)
allow users to subscribe to a single incident (t or f)
allow users to auto
allow users to subscribe for sms updates (t or f)
url of a hero cover image to be placed on your status page

queryParams.key: premium layout only, 850x315 or 1700x630 is best

queryParams.description: url of a transactional logo to be placed on your status page

queryParams.key: basic layout only, 170x45 or 340x90 is best

queryParams.description: custom css color for your status page body background
custom css color for your status page font
custom css color for your status page light font
custom css color for your status page greens
custom css color for your status page oranges
custom css color for your status page reds
custom css color for your status page yellows

queryParams.description: The name of the component
The description of the component
The id of the parent component (optional, only 1 level of nesting)

requests.name: Update a component
requests.description: Update a component

queryParams.description: The name of the component
The description of the component
The status, one of operational|degraded_performance|partial_outage|major_outage. To set a 3rd party component back to its official status, pass in a blank string ("component[status]=")

requests.name: Get a list of all incidents
requests.description: Get a list of all incidents

requests.name: Create a realtime incident
requests.description: Create a realtime incident

queryParams.description: The name of the incident
The status, one of investigating|identified|monitoring|resolved (optional, defaults to investigating if left blank)
The initial message, created as the first incident update (optional)
Post the new incident to twitter (t or f, defaults to f)
Override calculated impact value, one of none|minor|major|critical (optional)
List of components whose subscribers should be notified (only applicable for pages with component subscriptions enabled)
time the scheduled maintenance should begin (ISO8601 format)
time the scheduled maintenance should end (ISO8601 format)
Remind subscribers 60 minutes before scheduled start (optional, t or f, defaults to f)
Automatically transition incident to 'In Progress' at start (optional, t or f, defaults to f)
Automatically transition incident to 'Completed' at end (optional, t or f, defaults to f)
Must be set to t
Date of incident in YYYY

requests.name: Update an incident (only applies to realtime and scheduled incidents)
requests.description: Update an incident (only applies to realtime and scheduled incidents)

queryParams.key: at the same time to avoid two separate incident updates being generated.

queryParams.description: The name of the incident
The status, one of investigating|identified|monitoring|resolved (optional, defaults to investigating if left blank)
The initial message, created as the first incident update (optional)
Post the new incident to twitter (t or f, defaults to f)
Override calculated impact value, one of none|minor|major|critical (optional)
List of components whose subscribers should be notified (only applicable for pages with component subscriptions enabled)

requests.name: Create a user who can view your status page
requests.description: Create a user who can view your status page

queryParams.description: A concatenated (and possibly hashed) string of login parameters, organized alphabetically by field name.
The email for StatusPage to use to communicate with the user (required if StatusPage manages passwords for you)
Array of component ids that the created user will ba able to view
Array of metric ids that the created user will ba able to view
Array of PageAccessGroups (identified by code) that the created user will be a member of
A value of 'true' will subscribe the user to notifications for incidents associated with components they can see, this value is optional and defaults to false

requests.name: Delete a group
requests.description: Delete a group

queryParams.description: specifies what to do with any associated PageAccessUsers that are members of the group. Possible values are: 'destroy' (deletes the users), 'preserve' (unpacks access levels onto each user) and 'empty' (keeps the users but deletes all permissions) (optional, defaults to EMPTY)
